results.title: Starman
results.creator_credit: Larry Franco, Columbia Pictures and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: An alien (Jeff Bridges) makes a stopover on earth when he encounters the Voyager 2 probe. By masquerading as a human he has the opportunity, if only for a little while, to live like an ordinary man. His arrival is quickly discovered by a young woman (Karen Allen) who develops feelings for the Starman and agrees to assist him in the 2000 mile journey it will take him to get home. Cast includes Charles Martin Smith and Richard Jaeckel.

results.title: Starlife (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Traces the long evolution of a star from its birth in the depths of black nebula to its final extinction. Based on photographs taken with highly sophisticated instruments, animated drawings which propel the audience through the vast spaces of the universe, and bombard the eye with extra-terrestrial imagery of great beauty.

results.title: Starlife
results.brief_description: Traces the long evolution of a star from its birth in the depths of the black nebula to its final extinction. Based on photographs taken with highly sophisticated instruments, animated drawings which propel the audience through the vast spaces of the universe, and bombard the eye with extra terrestrial imagery of great beauty. To illustrate the different evolutionary paths followed by stars of different masses, a variety of stars is studied. The film also details the process of nucleosynthesis and explains red giants, “bursters”, the warping of spacetime and the mysterious “black hole.”

results.title: Stark
results.creator_credit: Cascade Ash, Film Victoria, Michael Wearing, David Parker, Timothy White and Nadia Tass
results.brief_description: Stark, the most powerful secret society on Earth could buy the Earth a thousand times and still make a takeover bid on God. So why is Stark desperate to buy a large slab of Aboriginal land in the Australian outback? CD, (Ben Elton), doesn’t care about the world, but he does care about getting laid, especially by Rachel, (Jacqueline McKenzie), a beautiful rebel looking for a cause. Together with Zimmerman and Walter, two Vietnam veterans, dippy hippy Karen and Christie Kettel, a New York journalist, they take on Stark to try and save the world from a toxic conspiracy. Filmed entirely in Australia, Stark combines Ben Elton’s brash, individual humour with a serious environmental message.

results.title: Starbreaker
results.creator_credit: Roman Kroitor, ONF | NFB and Bruce Mackay
results.brief_description: A science fiction story about two children who crash land their spacecraft on an unknown planet. They are captured by a wizard who rules over a lifeless land. As the story evolves the youngsters realise that the wizard, in his own way, is also a prisoner. A conflict between the protagonists leads to the wizard’s discovery of music and harmony, which ultimately prove to be the keys that spring the trap.

results.title: Star wars. Ep. 1: The Phantom menace [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Rick McCallum, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and George Lucas
results.brief_description: Another instalment in the “Star Wars” series - with a difference - director George Lucas choosing to trace what happened prior to the “original” “Star Wars” film, rather than following on from “The Return of the Jedi”. Obi-Wan Kenobi (Ewan McGregor), a young Jedi knight, is training under his mentor, Qui-Gon Jinn (Liam Neeson). When the planet Naboo is cut off by the Trade Federation, the Jedi Council orders Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon to settle the problem. They arrive in Naboo and meet Queen Amidala (Natalie Portman) who joins them on the trip to Coruscant to meet the Trade Federation. Unfortunately, they encounter difficulties with their spacecraft and are forced to make an emergency landing on Tatooine. While there, they meet Anakin Skywalker (Jake Lloyd), a slave boy, who will eventually father Luke Skywalker and become known as Darth Vader. Qui-Gon becomes convinced that Anakin is the leader the Jedi’s have been seeking and makes a bet to free Anakin from the slave contract he is bound to. On return to Naboo, war breaks out and the Jedi’s must fight against Darth Sidious (Ian McDiarmid), leader of the Trade Federation and his deadly henchman, dark Jedi, Darth Maul (Ray Park). One of the most anticipated films of the 90s, “The Phantom menace” includes cameo roles from Samuel L. Jackson and Terence Stamp.

results.title: Star wars (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Princess Leia is captured by the evil imperial forces in their efforts to take over the galactic Empire. Venturesome Luke Skywalker and dashing space captain Han Solo team together with the lovable Droids C-3PO and R2D2 to restore justice to the universe.

results.title: Star Wars
results.creator_credit: Gary Kurtz, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and George Lucas
results.brief_description: A Long time ago in a galaxy far far away, George Lucas’s space adventure captured the hearts and imaginations of film lovers of all ages from the moment these words scrolled across the screen. The Empire’s evil Death Star must be destroyed. The heroes, Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, Han Solo and a pair of droids named R2-D2 and C-3PO, as part of the Rebel Alliance, must pit their strength against the might of the Empire and the evil Jedi, Darth Vader. With the help of an old Jedi Knight, Obi-Wan Kenobi, they battle the forces of darkness and triumph. The special effects and famous “Star wars” theme music has ensured that this film takes its place in cinema history. Includes a ten minute interview between George Lucas and Leonard Maltin.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

constellations_other.name: Eighties hunks
constellations_other.description: Thor’s hero costume from Thor: Love and Thunder was inspired by classic comics of the eighties. Gone are the military greys, replaced with bright golds and bold colours. Let’s take a look at the lineage of eighties action heroes to which this version of Thor belongs.

results.title: Star trek: the motion picture
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Century Associates, Gene Roddenberry, Jon Povill and Robert Wise
results.brief_description: When a destructive space entity is spotted approaching Earth, Admiral Kirk resumes command of the Starship Enterprise in order to intercept, examine, and hopefully stop it. With it’s relentless flight towards Earth “V’ger’s” bloody-minded pursuit to find it’s “Creator”, Kirk and crew face possible Armageddon. Cast also includes Persis Khambatta as Lieutenant Ilia and Stephen Collins as Commander Decker. Interesting note: When Spock travels through V’ger and sees all the incredible imagery, look out for Darth Vader and Miss Piggy - right after his line “Who or what are we dealing with?”. Written by Allen Dean Foster. Original music by Jerry Goldsmith. Cinematography by Richard H. Kline.
